thread.title: LSE sells Proquote to market technology group Iress
thread.title_full: LSE sells Proquote to market technology group Iress | MENAFN.COM

author: ProactiveInvestors  UK
title: LSE sells Proquote to market technology group Iress
text: (MENAFN - ProactiveInvestors)The London Stock Exchange (LON:LSE) is off-loading trading and financial data service Proquote for an undisclosed sum. LSE is selling the retail trading network which serves retail stockbrokers market makers wealth managers institutional buyers and private investors to financial market technology supplier Iress. Australian-listed Iress supplies technology for financial markets wealth management and the mortgage industry in the UK and Australia. LSE said in a statement: "The group identified Proquote as not central to its strategy going forward for the enlarged information services division and in Iress identified the right partner for the business." The acquisition also includes LSEHub a FIX order routing business which provides trade order links between institutional investors and brokers. Iress is also buying Pulse Software Systems which provides portfolio management software for private asset managers. Iress chief executive Andrew Walsh said the Proquote deal would enable Iress to expand in the UK. "Regulatory change and market demands in the UK means there is an increasing need for unified flexible and reliable technology" he said. "These acquisitions allow us to expand capability and our client base as well as deepen our local expertise."
